H0.text: which of the following was a contribution thomas hunt morgan made to genetics. Gene

H1.text: which of the following was a contribution thomas hunt morgan made to genetics. Mutation

H2.text: which of the following was a contribution thomas hunt morgan made to genetics. Genetic Linkage

H3.text: which of the following was a contribution thomas hunt morgan made to genetics. Chromosome

A4.text: demonstrated that genes are carried on chromosomes and are the mechanical basis of heredity

A5.text: Morgan proposed that the amount of crossing over between linked genes differs and that crossover frequency might indicate the distance separating genes on the chromosome

A6.text: Thomas Hunt Morgan's work on inheritance and genetic linkage in the fruit fly Drosophila melanogaster provided incontrovertible evidence for the proposal.

A7.text: Morgan discovered that the white-eye mutation is located on the X chromosome

A8.text: Morgan elucidated the principle of sex-linked inheritance, which is a form of genetic linkage
